message_1: Consider the statement "I will finish my math homework before dinner". Represent this statement in temporal logic using the variables F and D, where F represents "finish math homework" and D represents "dinner". Write the statement as a formula in temporal logic and determine if it is true or false if "finish math homework" takes 2 hours and "dinner" is at 6 PM.
message_2:
In temporal logic, we can represent the statement "I will finish my math homework before dinner" as:

F → ◇D

This formula means that if F (finish math homework) is true, then eventually D (dinner) will be true.

Now, let's determine if this statement is true or false given that "finish math homework" takes 2 hours and "dinner" is at 6 PM. Suppose you start your math homework at 4 PM.

Since it takes 2 hours to finish the math homework, you will complete it at 6 PM. However, dinner is also at 6 PM. In this case, you are not finishing your math homework before dinner, so the statement is false.
